consolidation_metadata.indication: treatment of patients with advanced or unresectable hepatocellular carcinoma

consolidated_picos.Population: adults with HCC in Barcelona Clinic Liver Cancer (BCLC) stage B or C who did not receive any prior systemic therapy for the advanced or inoperable disease. Hepatic cirrhosis of any aetiology was not an exclusion criterion. Patients in BCLC stage B had to be ineligible for transarterial chemoembolization (TACE). Further inclusion criteria were Child-Pugh stage A and an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group – Performance Status (ECOG-PS) score of 0 or 1.

Grouping_Key.population: adults with HCC in Barcelona Clinic Liver Cancer (BCLC) stage B or C who did not receive any prior systemic therapy for the advanced or inoperable disease. Hepatic cirrhosis of any aetiology was not an exclusion criterion. Patients in BCLC stage B had to be ineligible for transarterial chemoembolization (TACE). Further inclusion criteria were Child-Pugh stage A and an Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group – Performance Status (ECOG-PS) score of 0 or 1.
